intro: Deinandra bacigalupii, commonly known as the Bacigalupi's lomatia, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes. Deinandra bacigalupii is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native habitat.
